brief_summary.textblock:
This research project follows two main objectives: 1) Assess anatomical and functional
      cerebral abnormalities in bipolar disorder. 2) Evaluate anatomical and functional changes
      after the application of a psychoeducational program in these patients. Specifically, this
      project aims to assess neurophysiological (fMRI - activation and functional connectivity)
      and neuroanatomical (morphometry and diffusion tensor imaging) specificities related to
      bipolar disorders and the therapeutic response to the psychoeducation. The results of this
      thesis project would also contribute to the validation of a pathophysiological model of the
      bipolar disorder.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Correlates of Bipolar Disorders and Effects of the Psychoeducation. an fMRI Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  clinical diagnosis of bipolar disorders

          -  euthymic (Montgomery and Asberg depression rating scale < 10, Young Mania rating
             scale < 10)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  other concomitant psychiatric disorders

intervention.description: Bipolar disorders are educated to learn about their pathology

clinical_study.official_title: Functional Correlates of Bipolar Disorders and Effects of the Psychoeducation. Assessment by Functional and Anatomic Neuroimaging.

primary_outcome.description: measurements were performed before (T1) and after (T2) educational program of 12 sessions .One session last one hour and half once a week (they come at the hospital for all sessions : i.e. during 12 weeks). Thus, T1 to T2 is 3 months (average).
primary_outcome.measure: fMRI measurement (neurophysiological [fMRI - activation and functional connectivity])
primary_outcome.time_frame: measurements were performed at T1 and T2 (up to 3 months)
